SENT.plain: A cerebellar infarction was found to be caused by a vascular thrombosis in a dog
The cause of the thrombosis was not determined
The dog had signs of a central vestibular disturbance
Scintigraphic imaging of the brain revealed evidence of increased uptake of the radionucleotide within the cranial vault
Analysis of CSF revealed albuminocytologic dissociation
Histologically, there was severe, locally extensive, well-demarcated hemorrhagic necrosis within the left cerebellar hemisphere
A mural thrombus was evident within a large meningeal artery
Although thrombosis of cerebrospinal vessels is rare in the dog, it should be considered in the differential diagnosis as a cause of acute CNS dysfunction
